#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Melt Glue Sticks
#Text=Glue sticks can be melted down for a number of applications .
#Text=Whether used in crafts , manufacturing , packaging , fashion , or in any other creative function , glue sticks are a cheap and easy to come by product .
#Text=All-purpose or school glue sticks and hot glue gun sticks can both be melted in the microwave , and hot glue gun sticks can , of course , be melted in a glue gun .
#Text=If handled carefully and done properly , the processes are extremely quick and can help you adhere all kinds of surfaces to one another .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Microwaving Glue Sticks
#Text=Remove the glue sticks from their original packaging .
#Text=All-purpose or school glue sticks can be unscrewed and pulled or broken off from their plastic casings .
#Text=Hot glue gun sticks simply need to be removed from any packaging or wrappers .
#Text=Make sure there are no plastics or other wrappings in or on the glue you want to melt .
#Text=Most wrappings and plastics are not intended to be melted and can be unsafe to do so .
#Text=If your glue stick has a plastic piece through the center , carefully cut the glue away from the plastic using a knife .
#Text=Put the stick(s) into a microwave-safe dish .
#Text=Since the glue will be very messy and hard to clean , use a single-use paper bowl .
#Text=If you are dedicating the dish to the craft of melting glue sticks , a ceramic or glass mug or bowl will also work .
#Text=Be sure the glue sticks are fully inside of the dish .
#Text=If they overhang the mug or bowl , they will melt outside of the dish .
#Text=Start with smaller quantities to test how long your particular glue takes to melt .
#Text=Microwave the glue on full power in 20-second intervals .
#Text=Depending on your microwave and amount of glue , you should at least be able to partially melt the sticks .
#Text=If there are still solids , microwave the glue for an additional 20 seconds after stirring it with a craft stick or plastic spoon .
#Text=Do not leave the microwave unattended .
#Text=If something goes wrong , you should be there to stop the microwave .
#Text=Do not heat the sticks for extended periods of time .
#Text=It may look like nothing is wrong while it heats , but overheating the glue can create fumes that are unsafe .
#Text=Remove the glue from the microwave carefully .
#Text=You should use it immediately , but be careful as the glue will be quite hot .
#Text=Depending on how long it was heated , the dish can be hot as well .
#Text=Use the glue fresh out of the microwave so it will be easy to apply .
#Text=If the glue re-hardens , simply microwave it for another 20 seconds .
#Text=Melting Glue Sticks with a Glue Gun
#Text=Obtain a glue gun at least as big as the glue sticks .
#Text=Only use hot glue sticks intended for glue guns — not all-purpose or school glue sticks .
#Text=If the sticks wo n’t fit into the glue gun , you cannot melt them .
#Text=If the sticks are too small , you will just have to use your hand to feed them through .
#Text=Make sure your glue sticks are meant for a glue gun .
#Text=You should not use other types of glue sticks because they can damage your glue gun .
#Text=Plug in the glue gun over cardboard or newspaper .
#Text=As the tip of the gun heats , the gun may start to drip as it melts .
#Text=By putting a piece of cardboard or newspaper underneath , you can protect your working surface .
#Text=Always follow the instructions specific to your glue gun regarding electricity and timing .
#Text=Do not leave a glue gun unattended .
#Text=They can tip over or otherwise cause severe burns if you are not careful .
#Text=Squeeze the trigger of the glue gun to feed the sticks .
#Text=If the sticks match the size of the glue gun , the trigger will allow the stick to press and feed through the heated tip .
#Text=The glue will then melt and drip out wherever you point the gun .
#Text=Do not touch the metal tip of the gun or the melting glue .
#Text=They will both be extremely hot .
#Text=If the glue is not feeding through , it may either be too large of a stick or may still be heating up .
#Text=If your glue stick is smaller than the glue gun , you will have to push from the back end of the stick to feed it through .
#Text=Use gloves to protect your hands from the heated materials .
#Text=Insert another stick once the first no longer feeds through .
#Text=If the gun or your fingers can no longer safely feed the first stick through the rear of the glue gun , use another glue stick to press it through .
#Text=It will then be caught by the plastic feeding mechanism and continue melting .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do not touch melted glue .
#Text=It will be extremely hot and adhere to your skin , making the burn worse .
#Text=Do not inhale melted glue fumes .
#Text=Some glues are non-toxic , but not all of them are .
#Text=Regardless , the fumes can be dangerous , and you may need to wear a respirator while working .
